content: [alette] Don't tell me this is how it has to be. It's what you chose!
[alette] Go back to Frostvellr! What more do you want?
/=Alette grips your arm tightly.=/
[alette] I don't... I don't want to feel that way. Don't become someone who isn't... my dad.
[alette] Please... for me. Don't do this.
[alette] Please... for me. Don't do this.

content.option: I'll only take them as prisoners
They can join us on our own terms
This is how it has to be
This is how it has to be

content: /=Alette runs back to the caravan, where Oddleif embraces her.=/
[alette] This isn't how it has to be! It's your choice!
[alette] Wait, dad... we, we can't do this. They're people. Like us.
[alette] What if our clansmen do start to lose hope... and look at you differently?
[alette] You tried to kill us! Just go back to Frostvellr and leave us alone!
/=As you reach slowly for an arrow, Alette grabs your wrist and speaks to you quietly.=/
[ekkill] Ah, Rook, it's your pretty girl. I'm glad nothing happened to her. With the dredge, I mean.
[ekkill] As for you, Onef, may the wolves feast on your corpse, you traitorous son of a bitch. I will haunt you.
[ekkill] Broke into my city. Took my warriors. Took one of my best men!
[ekkill] Broke into my city. Took my warriors. Took my food. Took one of my best men!
[ekkill] Broke into my city. Took my warriors. Took my food and then set the rest on fire, that was a nice touch. Took one of my best men!
[ekkill] Broke into my city. Took my warriors. Took my food and then killed some people so you could take more food, that was a nice touch. Took one of my best men!
[ekkill] But then look behind you. How many people is that? They follow you, fight for you. Why?
[ekkill] Frostvellr is done. I can't survive there, thanks to you, my good friends. You may not have cut my throat but you sentenced us to death.
[ekkill] How are you, Onef? Do they treat you well?
[ekkill] I don't believe that's who you are.
[ekkill] If that's what you have to do, do it.
[ekkill] I haven't survived because I'm crazy. I did what had to be done to make it in Frostvellr. The only mistake I made was you.
[ekkill] I may be reckless but I pay my debts.
[ekkill] I'm not above begging.
[ekkill] I'm your prisoner, Rook. Bind my hands.
[ekkill] It's more than that, isn't it?
/=Ekkill looks down at the ground, and the words come slowly to him.=/
[ekkill] Maybe that's more important than who you really are.
[ekkill] My friends, how could I forget everything you've done for me?
[ekkill] Nothing like that. You must think you know me... or people like me.
[ekkill] Now you're taking our weapons and leaving us in the wastes?
[ekkill] Oh, but you are special.
[ekkill] Remember my words, Rook. Who do they think you are?
[ekkill] As for you, Onef, may the wolves feast on your corpse, you traitorous son of a...
[ekkill] I'm not above begging.

content.option: Take Ekkill and his men as prisoners
Let them join you, on strict terms

content: [ekkill] Onef! We were good friends! What happened?
[ekkill] Remember my words, Rook. Who do they think you are?
[ekkill] Rook! We were good friends! What happened?
[ekkill] What kind of man are you?

content.option: I'm doing my best like everyone else
The kind who does what needs to be done

content: [ekkill] Sorry, what was your name? Seems like something I should know by now.
[ekkill] Then we have something in common. But unlike me, they gladly follow you.
[ekkill] These people are right to follow you, Rook. You're a good man.
[ekkill] Took my live bait. Took my warriors. Took one of my best men!
[ekkill] We're all doing our best. Why are you their leader? Why do they all look up to you?
[ekkill] What a pretty girl. Is she yours? I'm glad nothing happened to her. With the dredge, I mean.
[ekkill] What'd Onef tell you? I'm crazy?
[ekkill] What kind of man are you, Rook?
[ekkill] What kind of man are you?
[ekkill] Who do these people think you are? You saved them. You're a hero.
[ekkill] Why didn't you just put a knife in my head the second we met, Rook? Do we not even deserve a good death?
[ekkill] You can't trust me, I know that. Take me and my men, as prisoners, if that's what it takes.
[ekkill] You do us a greater honor than I had hoped, Rook. These people are right to follow you.
[ekkill] You'll have no trouble from us. I may be reckless but I pay my debts.
[ekkill] You look like an average man to me. A man worried about his daughter, maybe. Just making his way.
[ekkill] You think everyone was born to lead? Make hard decisions?
[onef] Ekkill was always the wild dog. You made the right choice, Rook.
[onef] I'd be a hypocrite if I told you to leave them.
[onef] I don't know, Rook. You don't know me. How could you trust my word any more than his?
[onef] I'm behind whatever decision you make.
[onef] I'm behind whatever decision you make.

content.option: Take Ekkill and his men as prisoners
Let Ekkill join you, on strict terms

content: [onef] Shove it up your ass, Ekkill. If you came out here to kill me, let's get it over with.
[onef] What's your point, Ekkill?
[rook] Alette, you'll understand one day... why it wasn't a choice.
[rook] And if you even look the wrong way at a single man, woman or child in this caravan, there will be no hesitation about killing you on the spot.
[rook] Do you understand?
[rook ekkill] Is this some kind of apology?
[rook ekkill] Rook.
[rook] I can't take a chance like this. Don't try to follow us.
[rook] Listen, Ekkill. We'll keep you alive, but look at one man, woman or child the wrong way and every last one of you gets cut down on the spot.
[rook] Things are hard enough as it is.
[rook] We need fighters. You fight the dredge just like the rest of us. You fight for everyone now, not just yourselves.
[rook] Why would I believe a word you say?
{skip} mark1= rook mark2=ekkill mark3=alette mark4=onef
/=The arrow pierces his eye. He falls over, dead in an instant, and Alette gasps in shock. She runs to Oddleif who embraces her.=/
/=The caravan eyes them suspiciously, but they try to fit in, following your orders. You expect to hear complaints about this. Things are definitely becoming complicated.=/
/=The weapons of the other men are gathered up, and they're left in the wastes. The caravan continues on without a word, though you can feel their eyes on you.=/
/=You deftly pull the arrow and aim at Ekkill's head. He looks straight into your eyes, unflinching.=/
/=You have each man's hands bound tightly and their bodies checked for weapons, making sure no mistakes are made. Things are certainly starting to feel complicated.=/
/=You have your allies gather up the weapons from Ekkill's fighters.=/
/=You pull away in silence, leaving the group of warriors weaponless and without food in the middle of a frozen wasteland. Ekkill falls to his knees. They make no effort to follow.=/
